body.p: Here are some more documentation if you want to know more than just make the demos.

section.title: Constraint Grammar
section.p: Constraint grammar is used in Sahka and Vasta. This is an article based on a presentation held at NODALIDA 2009 CG workshop in Odense.
Antonsen, L., Huhumarniemi, S. and Trosterud, T. 2009: Constraint Grammar in Dialogue Systems

section.title: The linguistic files
section.p: Files for OAHPA are in the ped-directory.

p.strong: The pedagogical lexicon. Files for generating the database of word forms:

ul.li: sme/xml/semantic_sets.xml (some of the smaller Morfa-sets make bigger Leksa supersets)
isme-GG.restr.fst (generates word forms according to western dialect)
isme-KJ.restr.fst (generates word forms according to eastern dialect)

section.p: Files with more words from text books: sme/src/adv.txt sme/src/conj.txt sme/src/pp.txt The words are not generated. The files are not in use today.

Files for giving feedback about morphology in Morfa-S:

section.p: The feedback-files add feedbacktags based on a combination of the morphological features specified in the lexicon, and the task itself. With help of the tags the system generates feedback messages for the user. Many small messages are linked together to a longer message.

p.strong: Other files offering help to the user:

section.p: sme/xml/comments.nob.xml (comments to the user aobut how she is succeeding with the tasks.)
sme/src/grammatikklinker.txt (links to the grammar documentation. The grammar files are in userdoc/)

p.strong: Files for analysing the free input in Sahka and Vasta:

section.p: ped-sme.fst gives morphological analysis to the user's input. It is normative, but it allows proper nouns written with small initial letter, but marks it with an error tag.
sme/src/sme-ped.cg3 disambuguates and adds grammar error and navigation tags to the user's input.
